item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "I'd like to be the sort of person who can enjoy things at the time, instead of having to go back in my head and enjoy them." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Never regret thy fall, O Icarus of the fearless flight For the greatest tragedy of them all Is never to feel the burning light." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "No one gossips about other peopleâ€™s secret virtues." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Robert Orben
item.description: "Illegal aliens have always been a problem in the United States. Ask any Indian." -- Robert Orben

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "He had just about enough intelligence to open his mouth when he wanted to eat, but certainly no more." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "At the age of eleven or thereabouts women acquire a poise and an ability to handle difficult situations which a man, if he is lucky, manages to achieve somewhere in the later seventies." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "In a series of events, all of which had been a bit thick, this, in his opinion, achieved the maximum of thickness." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Books serve to show a man that those original thoughts of his aren't very new after all." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "And he took her in his arms and kissed her under the sunlit sky, and he cared not that they stood high upon the walls in the sight of many." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "When I think of what life is, and how seldom love is answered by love; it is one of the moments for which the world was made." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Stephen Crane
item.description: "Held his heart in his hands, And ate of it. I said: "Is it good, friend?" "It is bitter - bitter," he answered; "But I like it Because it is bitter, And because it is my heart." -- Stephen Crane

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "If I had a flower for every time I thought of you...I could walk through my garden forever." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "I became insane, with long intervals of horrible sanity." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Henry Rollins
item.description: "Half of life is fucking up, the other half is dealing with it." -- Henry Rollins

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Henry Rollins
item.description: "Knowledge without mileage equals bullshit." -- Henry Rollins

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Henry Rollins
item.description: "I believe that one defines oneself by reinvention. To not be like your parents. To not be like your friends. To be yourself. To cut yourself out of stone." -- Henry Rollins

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Henry Rollins
item.description: "I could fall in love with a cruel desert that kills without passion, a canyon full of scorpions, one thousand blinding arctic storms, a century sealed in a cave, a river of molten salt flowing down my throat. But never with you." -- Henry Rollins

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Henry Rollins
item.description: "After... The seas have dried out The trains have come to a shrieking holt The hounds of the abyss cease to howl The prisons have closed their doors The pigs have no one to arrest except themselves The drugs no longer have an effect When it's all over All I'll remember is you" -- Henry Rollins

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Henry Rollins
item.description: "I'll be here tomorrow If I can make it through today." -- Henry Rollins

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Henry Rollins
item.description: "Scar tissue is stronger than regular tissue. Realize the strength, move on." -- Henry Rollins

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Henry Rollins
item.description: "My optimism wears heavy boots and is loud." -- Henry Rollins

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Henry Rollins
item.description: "Life will not break your heart. It'll crush it." -- Henry Rollins

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Jonathan Carroll
item.description: "I forgive nothing. If you stole my orange crayon in the fifth grade, you're still on my hit list, buddy." -- Jonathan Carroll

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Michel Faber
item.description: "A single day spent doing things which fail to nourish the soul is a day stolen, mutilated, and discarded in the gutter of destiny." -- Michel Faber

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Mark Knopfler
item.description: "Sometimes you're the windshield. Sometimes your the bug." -- Mark Knopfler
